author: wsjcom
title: Netflix Has Competitors, Medicare Doesn’t
text:
Ezekiel J. Emanuel and Bob Kocher are two of the leading voices in government-run health care, including their contributions to the Affordable Care Act (“What Medicare Could Learn from Netflix,” op-ed, Feb. 21). The basis of their op-ed is the necessity of “risk adjustment” and how to use it when dealing with Medicare Advantage patients. Risk adjustment is simply another term for underwriting. Ironically, through community rating and the pre-existing condition mandate, the architects of the bill essentially banned underwriting from ObamaCare.
Although...
